Geospatial tools for NC PFAS Testing Network

Helena Mitasova

A. Petrasova,     V. Petras,     W. Reckling,     B. Baines,     S. Reckling

   

Outline

  • overview of PFAS Testing Network geospatial data with maps of locations
  • Drinking water sources: water systems, sources and sampling sites
  • Sampling routing tools: conditions, modules parameters and results
  • Rapid viewing of GPS data with attributes

  • Groundwater seepage through streams

  • PFAS Testing Network on-line mapping tool prototype
include graphics maps

PFAST Network geospatial data

Team 1: Drinking water sources, Team 2: Groundwater seepage in streams, Team 4: Atmospheric monitoring sites, Team 5a: Landfills, waste water plants Team 3, Team 5b not added yet Integration of all test data should provide a big picture of PFAS status in NC

Drinking water sources

  • one or more surface water sources (all sampled)

Drinking water sources

  • one or more surface water sources (all sampled)
  • one or more well water sources (just one sampled)

    Municipial or county, mixed water possible.

Georeferencing drinking water sources

Several GPS coordinates may be associated with each drinking source
  • DEQ location
  • sampled water intake
  • sampled tap

Drinking water sources routing tool

Sampling sites database

Duke integrates sample analysis results in SQLite database - each site has XX attributes, including the PFAS concentrations and GPS coordinates

Samples are matched with DEQ data as much as possible - this provides additional variables: well gw production, adress, contacts, etc.

WS service area

Who is drinking the water: sampled water sources are coupled with service area layer number of people, number of connections, history, etc.

Drinking water infrastructure

Some towns and cities have detailed data GIS datalayers on WS infrastructure

Contributing areas

We are deriving contributing areas for each sampling site

Potential sources in contributing areas

Airports, fire fighting training sites, military installations, landfills, water water plants

Land use history in contributing areas

Mapping land use composition since 1974 (landsat), using NWALT data

View data from spreadsheets

Kepler: easy viewing of simple csv files with GPS data

name the columns where you have the coordinates as follows: name_lat, name_long

drop file into Kepler

adjust symbology based on attributes, filter data, etc.
